statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: PARADISE JAM AT ST THOMAS VIRGIN ISLANDS

article.description:
Alonzo Gee had 21
points and six rebounds to lead No. 11 Alabama to a 72-60 victory
over Iowa in the U.S. Virgin Islands Paradise Jam on Sunday.
article.headline: Balanced offensive attack helps Alabama hold off Iowa
article.linkText: Balanced offensive attack helps Alabama hold off Iowa
article.story: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, U.S. Virgin Islands (AP) -- Jermareo Davidson's return gave Alabama (No. 11 ESPN/USA Today; No. 10 AP) the spark it needed to overcome Iowa. Davidson had 15 points, 11 rebounds, four blocks and four assists after a one-game absence, and Alonzo Gee added 21 points and six rebounds to lead the Crimson Tide (3-0) to a 72-60 victory over the Hawkeyes (2-1) at the U.S. Virgin Islands Paradise Jam on Sunday. "I'm just trying to focus on what I need to do," said Davidson, who had missed Friday's win over Middle Tennessee State when he remained stateside to mourn his girlfriend, who died in a car wreck last week. "It didn't really affect my game. It's just a matter of getting back in the rhythm." Ronald Steele added 18 points, six assists and four rebounds, and Richard Hendrix had 14 points and seven rebounds for Alabama. "It was really key having him back," Steele said of Davidson. "We played with a lot more emotion. That was kind of the lift we needed." Davidson acknowledged he needed his team as much as they needed him: "They lift my spirits up, got me going." Alabama won by dominating in the paint. Falling on his back at the top of the key, Davidson lobbed an alley-oop to Hendrix early in the second half. On the next play Davidson blocked a jumper by Cyrus Tate. "(Davidson) gives this team a lot of confidence. And he played great. He played with a lot of heart," coach Mark Gottfried said. Tyler Smith led Iowa with 19 points, seven rebounds, four assists and two steals. Tony Freeman added 16 points, four rebounds and three assists. Gee made two consecutive steals for breakaway dunks in the closing minutes of the first half.
